text: A woman in Bengaluru was sexually assaulted during her morning walk on Friday. Despite bravely resisting and managing to break free, she had to fend off an assailant who tried to kiss her. Unfortunately, no one came to her aid despite her screams. The incident was captured on local CCTV footage.
title: On cam: Woman molested during morning walk in Bengaluru

text: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) escorted two terrorists, Adbul Matheen Taha and Mussavir Hussain Shazeb, to The Rameshwaram Cafe in Bengaluru for a spot inspection. The suspects were arrested in West Bengal in April following a bomb blast on March 1, injuring 10 people. The NIA conducted extensive searches across multiple locations during the investigation.
title: Rameshwaram cafe blast: NIA takes 2 terrorists to Bengaluru eatery for spot inspection

text: Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar targeted Union Minister HD Kumaraswamy, accusing him of acquiring vast benami land through his brother, former KAS officer HD Balakrishna. Shivakumar urged Kumaraswamy to clarify the property amassed by his brother. He also criticized the BJP-JD(S) alliance, claiming it was formed purely for political convenience.

text: The Karnataka government handed over the investigation into sub-inspector Parashurama's death to the CID after his wife accused a Congress MLA and his son of abetment to suicide. The state promised a job and financial assistance to Parashurama's widow. Opposition leader R Ashoka criticized the ruling party, alleging corruption and targeting of Dalits.

text: Gautam Adani, chairman of Adani Group, planned to step down at age 70 and cede control to his sons and their cousins around 2030. Adani's elder son Karan, younger son Jeet, along with cousins Pranav and Sagar, would become equal beneficiaries of the family trust, a report suggests.
title: Gautam Adani, Adani Group chairman, to step down at 70; shift control to sons and their cousins: Report

text: The non-life arm of the country's largest bank said that it has not decided how much of the increased cost will be passed on to the policyholder yet.
title: SBI General Insurance: Cut in wait time for existing diseases to up costs

text: Gadkari's suggestion for removal of the levy is unimplementable, since it will break the GST chain, denying refunds to those who sell goods or services to insurers.
title: Why GST rate rationalisation is both due & needed

text: The UK government, under Prime Minister Keir Starmer, announced plans to host a global investment conference on October 14. The summit, led by Business Minister Jonathan Reynolds, is set to gather up to 300 industry leaders to boost investment and economic growth. Starmer aims to raise the UK's growth rate to 2.5 per cent annually.
title: Britain to hold international investment summit on October 14
'They have been foolish ... ': Elon Musk slams Fed for not dropping interest rates

text: The finance ministry directed state-owned general insurers to focus on profitability over top-line growth. Following Rs 7,250 crore in capital infusions, companies like Oriental Insurance saw profitable turnarounds. Efforts now prioritize profitable lines of business, exiting loss-making segments such as motor and health insurance, aiming for sustainable improvements without further capital infusions.
title: Finance ministry asks state-owned insurance companies to focus on profitable businesses

text: Foreign portfolio investors continued their buying spree in Indian stock markets for the second consecutive month, investing Rs 32,365 crore in July. This surge occurred amid domestic investor activity, leading indices Sensex and Nifty to record highs. Influenced by election results, FPIs may adjust investments based on global economic trends and the performance of various sectors.
title: Foreign portfolio investors continue buying spree in Indian stock markets

text: The administrator of debt-laden Reliance Capital accused Hinduja Group's IIHL of failing to meet conditions set by NCLT, as IIHL allegedly deposited money in its own accounts instead of designated escrow accounts. IIHL denied the claims, citing a lack of provided escrow terms. The hearing on IIHL's plea is set for next week.
title: Reliance Capital administrator accuses IIHL of non-compliance with NCLT order

text: Pakistan received five bids from Chinese firms to help raise funds via Panda bonds, marking a significant step in returning to global capital markets. This move aims to diversify funding sources and reduce reliance on Western financial markets. Fitch’s upgraded credit rating and an IMF loan deal bolstered Pakistan's credibility, encouraging further fundraising efforts globally.
title: Can Panda bonds solve Pakistan's economic woes?
India plans tougher ad curbs on liquor makers such as Carlsberg, Diageo, Pernod

text: Hardeep Puri, minister for petroleum and natural gas, announced the expansion of Assam's Numaligarh Refinery from 3 MMTPA to 9 MMTPA, with completion expected by 2024. A 1,640 km pipeline from Paradip Port to Numaligarh is also under construction for transporting imported crude. The project, costing Rs 28,026 crore, was environmentally cleared in July 2020.
title: Capacity of Numaligarh Refinery in Assam to be increased 3 -fold: Puri

text: In India, a key emerging market economy, analysts are pointing out that loosening monetary policy through interest rate cuts in the US amid weak growth projections could drive in investment inflows into India.
title: Slowdown, likely rate cut in US will drive foreign investment to India: Experts

text: Telangana saw its IT sector exports grow by 11.2% to Rs 2,68,233 crore in the last financial year, well above the national average. Over 40,000 jobs were created, increasing sector employment by 4.5%. The state plans to double the number of Global Capability Centres in Hyderabad and aims to become a leader in AI and technological innovation.
title: Telangana IT exports clock 11% growth to Rs 2.68 lakh cr in FY24

text: S&P Global Ratings reported that state-backed digital initiatives in India could lead to a tripling of retail borrowing by 2030, raising household debt to USD 2.5 trillion. Despite a rise in financial inclusion, credit penetration remains low. Micro-loans to low-income earners may grow, and finance companies dominate mass-market loans.
title: Digital initiatives to triple Indian retail borrowing to USD 2.5 trillion by 2030: S&P Global

text: The upcoming week's market trajectory will be influenced by the Reserve Bank of India's interest rate decision, macroeconomic indicators, and international market trends, according to market analysts. Additionally, the trading patterns of foreign investors and the final set of first-quarter earnings reports will also play a role in shaping the direction of the stock market.
title: What are the major factors driving market trends

text: Israel Aerospace Industries (IAI) had been in discussions with Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd (HAL) and another company to establish a passenger to freighter (P2F) conversion facility in India within the next two years. It is also keen to have an engine maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) in India, IAI’s EVP (aviation group) Shmuel Kuzi told TOI.
title: 'Israel Aerospace Industries in talks with HAL for wide body P2F conversion facility in India'

text: SBI's Chairman Dinesh Kumar Khara stated that discouraging retail investors from derivative market bets might help banks secure more deposits. Regulatory actions, including adjustments to capital gains, and SEBI's measures addressing losses in derivative trades, aim to curb speculative activities. Despite setbacks, SBI targets 15% credit growth and 8% deposit growth in fiscal year 2025.
title: Discouraging retail play in F&O may help boost bank deposits: SBI Chairman Khara

text: A 53-year-old head constable, Kumaran, died in a head-on collision while on patrol duty in Chennai. The incident occurred when a high-speed bike collided with his vehicle on the Tambaram-Maduravoyal Bypass. Kumaran was thrown off his bike and died on the spot, while the biker survived with minor injuries. An investigation is ongoing.
title: Chennai cop dies after being hit by speeding bike
Dindigul end long wait for maiden title

text: In the second ODI between India and Sri Lanka, Sri Lanka won by 32 runs, taking a 1-0 lead in the series. A key moment was Shreyas Iyer's direct hit run out of Kamindu Mendis in the last over. India, despite restricting Sri Lanka to 240/9, faltered against spin and were bundled out for 208 in 42.2 overs.
title: Watch: Shreyas Iyer's gun throw to run out Kamindu Mendis

text: India and Sri Lanka's three-match ODI series has been marred by controversy following a Decision Review System incident in the second ODI. The incident arose from a call involving Virat Kohli. Sri Lanka's spinner Jeffrey Vandersay's impressive performance, taking 6 for 33, helped bowl India out for 208 in 42.2 overs. However, the DRS decision left the Sri Lankan team frustrated.
title: Watch: SL players stunned, Mendis threw helmet as DRS saved Kohli

text: Jeffrey Vandersay was brought into Sri Lanka’s ODI squad shortly before the second ODI against India, replacing Wanindu Hasaranga who was out with a hamstring injury. Vandersay made an impressive impact, claiming 6 wickets for 33 runs. His remarkable spell thwarted India's chase and clinched a notable 32-run victory for Sri Lanka at the R. Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.
title: How Rohit's dismissal fueled Vandersay's match-winning performance

text: During the ECS Bulgaria T10 match, Afyonkarahisar SHS's Kursad Dalyan made a remarkable catch against VTU-MU Pleven. Dalyan's unconventional effort helped restrict Pleven to 40/8, contributing to his team's victory. The catch occurred when Anandhu Krishna attempted a drive, only for Dalyan to complete the catch using his shoe.
title: 'Leg Before Catch': An unconventional catch goes viral - Watch

text: Sri Lanka defeated India by 32 runs, taking a 1-0 series lead. Jeffrey Vandersay's superb six-wicket haul for 33 runs dismantled the Indian batting lineup, leading to India’s collapse from 97 for 1 to 208 all out. Rohit Sharma's 64 and Shubman Gill's 35 set a strong foundation, but Vandersay's spin proved too challenging, dismissing key players including Sharma and Virat Kohli. Sri Lanka’s lower-order contributions and effective spin bowling were crucial in setting a competitive total and securing the win.
title: Jeffrey Vandersay grabs six as Sri Lanka sink India in second ODI

text: The second ODI between India and Sri Lanka in Colombo on Sunday saw a dramatic run-out of Akila Dananjaya off the last ball of home team's innings. The Lankans, however, went on to win the match by 32 runs to take a 1-0 lead in the three match series. The opening ODI last Friday had ended in a tie.
title: Watch: Rohit missed, Virat hit, run-out effected

text: Indian skipper Rohit Sharma termed the 32-run defeat against Sri Lanka in the second ODI as hurting, and said there will be discussions about the way batters played in the middle-overs in Colombo on Sunday.
title: It hurts when you lose, and there will be talks about our batting: Rohit

text: While the match highlights included several cricketing moments, led by the six-wicket haul by Sri Lankan legspinner Jeffrey Vandersay (6 for 33), the crowd was also entertained when Virat Kohli showed his dance moves for a brief moment. Sri Lanka defeated India by 32 runs to take a 1-o lead in the three-match series, with one game left to play.
title: Watch: When Virat showed his dance moves during 2nd ODI vs SL

text: India star Ravichandran Ashwin played a captain's knock as Dindigul Dragons claimed their maiden title in the Tamil Nadu Premier League (TNPL) with a six-wicket victory over Lyca Kovai Kings in Chennai on Sunday.

text: Late cameos by Kamindu Mendis and Dunith Wellalage lifted Sri Lanka to 240 for 9 after India's spinners struck regular blows. Wellalage, who made 39, and fellow left-hander Kamindu, who hit 40, boosted the total with a 72-run seventh-wicket stand after Sri Lanka slipped to 136-6. Washington Sundar returned figures of 3 for 30 and was ably supported by fellow spinner Kuldeep Yadav, who took two wickets with his left-arm wrist spin.

text: England opener Zak Crawley has been ruled out of the forthcoming Test series against Sri Lanka due to a broken finger. Crawley has been ruled out after he fractured the little finger on his right hand while attempting to take a catch during the recent third Test victory over the West Indies.

text: Gautam Gambhir's stint as the head coach of the Indian cricket team began positively, with the team, led by newly appointed skipper Suryakumar Yadav, achieving a 3-0 clean sweep against Sri Lanka in the three-match T20I series. text: The helicopter shot -- an aerial whip from the off and middle stump to a delivery pitched up -- was made famous by former India captain MS Dhoni, who is known to have invented it during his heydays. text: The PCB has left it up to the International Cricket Council to convince the BCCI to send its team to Pakistan for the upcoming Champions Trophy. The PCB chief also recently advised its office and colleagues to not issue any statements related to India's decision on sending its team.

text: Ahead of the TNPL final, veteran Indian off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin and Lyca Kovai Kings captain Shahrukh Khan discussed their evolving skills. Ashwin, representing Dindigul Dragons, has focused on expanding his batting repertoire, notably using reverse sweeps, becoming his team's third-highest run-scorer. Shahrukh credited his stint with Gujarat Titans for improving his technique against spin bowling, which has boosted his performance in the TNPL. Both players’ enhancements add intrigue to the final showdown at the MA Chidambaram Stadium.

text: The government planned to restore the Natural Conservation Zone (NCZ) in the Regional Plan 2041 for the NCR, which aims to protect areas like the Aravali ridge and major water bodies. The draft will maintain the definition of the Aravali range as designated in a 1992 notification unless directed otherwise by competent authorities or the Supreme Court.
title: Centre may reinstate NCZ in Draft Regional Plan to protect Aravalis

text: A retired IRS official and his wife were injured during an early morning burglary at their Vasant Kunj home in southwest Delhi. The suspect, Jitender from Meerut, also threatened to kill the official. Police have arrested Jitender and another man for harboring him, while investigating further into the incident.
title: Knife-armed burglar breaks into retired IRS official's home in Delhi's Vasant Kunj

text: Delhi Police detained a man in Rohini after locals reported slogans supporting Pakistan on the wall of his flat. Initial investigations indicated the man might be mentally unstable and living alone. Police are checking for any connections with Pakistan or related groups and have confiscated objectionable posters and banners from his room. Family members are being contacted for more details.
title: Men held for putting pro-Pakistan posters at Delhi home

text: Delhi Police apprehended Sanjeev Jain, MD and CEO of Parsvnath Developers Pvt Ltd, following a non-bailable warrant issued by the National Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission. Jain was nabbed after a 60km pursuit from IGI Airport in Delhi. The warrant was related to an execution application filed by Rajat Babbar. Jain is currently undergoing further legal proceedings.
title: Parsvnath CEO held at Delhi airport after 60-km chase

text: Delhi experienced light showers on Sunday evening, with more intense rain expected from Tuesday to Thursday. The city's base station, Safdarjung, recorded 4.5mm of rainfall. The India Meteorological Department forecasted very light to light rain for Monday, with strong surface winds. The maximum temperature reached 36 degrees Celsius, while the air quality remained 'satisfactory' with an AQI of 62.
title: Brace for intense rain spell in Delhi-NCR on Tuesday, Wednesday: IMD

text: Raj Niwas reported that vital drains in New Delhi, including Barapullah, Sunehri, and Kushak Nalla, had not been maintained for years, causing severe flooding. LG VK Saxena inspected the drains and directed immediate cleaning. AAP criticized the delayed response, blaming the chief secretary for ignoring previous orders regarding desilting efforts.
title: Delhi LG VK Saxena says three crucial drains not desilted for years, AAP hits back

text: On average, 70 buses from the Delhi Transport Corporation and Cluster Scheme broke down daily, causing significant commuter inconvenience and traffic congestion. With many buses over 10 years old, mechanical issues were frequent. The Delhi government planned to introduce 2,000 electric buses by December 2025 to address this problem while ensuring better maintenance for existing buses.
tags: Delhi Transport Corporation and Cluster Scheme
title: Roadblock ahead: Breaking down reasons for your road travel pains

text: The Supreme Court announced it would deliver its verdict on August 5 regarding the Delhi government's challenge to the lieutenant governor's nomination of aldermen to the MCD without council advice. The case involves power dynamics affecting the elected MCD.
title: Supreme Court verdict on Delhi govt's plea on MCD aldermen likely today

text: The Maharashtra State CET Cell has released the MAH MCA 2024 provisional merit list on August 3, 2024. Candidates can view their rankings on mca2024.mahacet.org.in. Grievances can be submitted from August 4 to August 6, 2024, with final corrections and acknowledgements available in candidates' logins. The final merit list will be published on August 8, 2024. title: MAH MCA 2024 Provisional Merit List Released at mca2024.mahacet.org.in; Check Direct Link Here

text: The Controller of Examinations (CEE), Kerala, has released the KEAM 2024 trial allotment today, August 5. Candidates can view their trial results on cee.kerala.gov.in. The trial allotment, based on options submitted until August 4, provides an indication of potential allotments but does not guarantee placement. Candidates have until 5 PM today to adjust their preferences. For assistance, the helpline number is 0471-2525300.
title: KEAM Counselling 2024: Trial Allotment and Final Category List Released at cee.kerala.gov.in

text: In response to safety concerns following the deaths of three civil service aspirants in Delhi, Patna DM Chandrashekhar Singh announced that coaching centres operating from basements will be sealed immediately. An inspection drive has revealed no such centres in Patna yet. Coaching institutes have one month to comply with registration rules, and measures are being taken to ensure student safety, including proper infrastructure and clear entry/exit points, as stated by Singh to PTI.
title: Patna DM Orders Immediate Sealing of Coaching Centres Operating from Basements

text: A leaked confidential letter from the National Board of Examinations in Medical Sciences (NBEMS) reveals details about the NEET PG 2024 exam, raising serious concerns about the exam's security. The leak includes sensitive information such as exam dates, candidate numbers, and exam centres. This breach has sparked criticism and doubts about the integrity of the upcoming examination.

text: Studying abroad offers exciting opportunities for growth and cultural exploration but also presents challenges like homesickness, adapting to new cultures, language barriers, and financial issues. text: The Times of India Right to Excellence Education Summit at GL Bajaj Institute in Greater Noida discussed bridging the education-employment gap through digital transformation and AI in classrooms. text: The Right to Excellence Education summit addressed the role of technology in education. Dr. Kalpana Johari underscored technology's crucial role during challenging times. text: Denver city pays $3.76 million in damages due to a wrongful raid caused by Apple's Find My app. An elderly woman's home was mistakenly raided by the police while searching for a stolen truck loaded with guns, ammo, and cash, as reported by CNN. text: Stock market crash today: BSE Sensex plummeted over 2,400 points and the Nifty slipped below the 24,300-level in opening trade. text: Paris Olympics witnessed the closest ever men's 100m final in modern history and two statistics highlight that the most. One, the difference between the gold and the silver medal was five thousandth of a second. And two, it marked the first ever men's 100m race where each of the eight runners clocked under 10 seconds with a legal wind factor.

text: The tech industry witnessed significant layoffs in July 2024, with over 8,000 professionals losing their jobs across 34 companies. Major layoffs include Intel's 15,000 job cuts and UKG's 2,200. Other notable companies like Microsoft, Intuit, and Dyson also downsized. Startups and smaller firms such as ReshaMandi, Koo, and WayCool faced severe cuts and closures.

text: A 53-year-old head constable, Kumaran, died in a head-on collision while on patrol duty in Chennai. The incident occurred when a high-speed bike collided with his vehicle on the Tambaram-Maduravoyal Bypass. Kumaran was thrown off his bike and died on the spot, while the biker survived with minor injuries. An investigation is ongoing.

text: ED has claimed the two bureaucrats in the then Baghel-led Congress govt were tampering with evidence to dilute the case against them. text: The telecom industry expressed concerns over new QoS norms by Trai, claiming they impose excessive burdens. COAI, representing major telecom operators, highlighted challenges such as right-of-way issues, equipment theft, and frequent fiber cuts. The industry seeks regulations that consider these practical difficulties while maintaining high service quality standards and avoiding undue financial pressure on operators.
title: Reliance Jio, Airtel and Vodafone-Idea 'unhappy' with Trai's new QoS rules

text: A woman in Bengaluru was sexually assaulted during her morning walk on Friday. Despite bravely resisting and managing to break free, she had to fend off an assailant who tried to kiss her. title: On cam: Woman molested during morning walk in Bengaluru

text: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) escorted two terrorists, Adbul Matheen Taha and Mussavir Hussain Shazeb, to The Rameshwaram Cafe in Bengaluru for a spot inspection. text: The Tokyo Olympics bronze medallists will have only 15 players available to play the last-four clash instead of a full squad of 16 after defender Amit Rohidas was suspended for one match following his red card in the quarterfinal against Great Britain. text: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway reduced its stake in Apple by half, as part of a $76 billion stock sell-off.
